Reviews.Title: “Horrible smell of smoke!”
Reviews.Author: lmblmr
Reviews.Content: I have been in hotels with smoking rooms before, but I have never smelled a hallway smell so bad from the smoke! I even saw another group of guests turn around after check-in and say they would absolutely not stay there! The room itself did not smell, it was clean and comfortable. The bathroom fan was dated and so loud. I would not stay here again due to the smell of the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor but Iv seen worse”
Reviews.Author: cody91
Reviews.Content: Im surprised Comfort Inn hasn't shut this one down. Room was fair, water pressure is very weak, could barely shower, AC worked great but didn't seem to take humidity out of air but was cool, bed comfort was old and dirty, I took it off bed, sheet were clean, pillows nice. But no elevator and stair very narrow for second floor. door to stairs had broken door handle, if that door had been closed you would have been trapped in case of a fire...carpet in halls were worst iv ever seen, very dirty, torn, holes. Desk was friendly and helpful to me. By way, smell of stale carpet and beer smell in halls. I probably would not stay again, but maybe its worth the discount of $49.

Reviews.Title: “This was one of the worst hotels we've ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: hopesma
Reviews.Content: Our standards on a road trip are pretty low. Clean beds, decent breakfast, close to the highway. It does not have to be fancy & worn is ok as long as clean. This hotel was dirty and our room was awful. Chunks of the ceiling on the floor, dripping shower, towel bar fell off the wall when I touched it, and the carpet had a really icky, tacky feel. I made the kids keep their shoes on. If it weren't so late & we were all tired, I probably would have moved hotels or rooms. Even the kids were commenting & we did not bother to stay for breakfast. If the hotel was in that poor shape, I certainly didn't want to eat any of their food! YUCK. I have about had it w/Choice hotels, the quality is so inconsistent.

Reviews.Title: “One night and we're out!”
Reviews.Author: landry4
Reviews.Content: Had reservations for 3 nights at this hotel. It was so bad that we packed up and moved after the first night. The room had a horrible musty smell. Ceiling looked like had weathered several leaks. The bathroom ceiling had a recent leak that was still wet, the light was wrapped in a plastic bag and the bathroom vent was dangling. When we attempted to check out the next morning there was no one at the front desk. When my husband called the number, they said they were busy and it would be a while before they could come to check us out . . . we left!

Reviews.Title: “Too dirty even for a free night stay!”
Reviews.Author: jgmaa
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be closed due to "renovations". We made reservations for this hotel well in advance using our points to stay for a free night. When we pulled up at 1:15am after driving 10 hours. There were 8-9 teen males running and playing in the parking lot. Hotel attendant was outside smoking. He was the hotel check in attendant, security officer, and housekeeper. The room was not worthy of a free night. 1) Someone had started painting one wall in the room, 2) ceiling had water stains, and small hole over bed...slight leak from this hole. 3)Bathroom also had water stains all over ceiling, mold over shower head, damp and unfolded towels (as if someone had already been in the room). 4) Room smelled very spoiled. 5)Pillow cases were yellowed 6)Hotel hallway had not been vacuumed in weeks, as there were ants in the staircase as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value At Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: Sliphorn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Comfort Inn while coming to Indy to play a dance. I chose it because it is right off I 65 at Keystone AND because I got a very good price. I expected a flophouse but was surprised that it was like other Comfort Inns all over the country. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast was top-notch with the famous waffle maker. I had a room on the second floor (of two) and had no problem with noise from other guests (just noise from the thunderstorm that hit the area). The AC was a window unit but there was an easy chair in front of it to block direct winds from it. The shower was nice and new and the room was clean. I will stay here again if I come to the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cindy-Milford
Reviews.Content: Nice 3-1/2 star business hotel Pluses: Extremely helpful front desk and staff. Comfortable beds nicely decorated. QUIET rooms, in fact this was one of the quietest hotels I have stayed in in some time. Rooms are moderate in size though not huge and have a small seating area. Bathroom is a bit cramped for 2 if you are sharing but it was sufficient. Pool area nicely maintained (indoor). Breakfast bar included and they have a waffle maker if you enjoy a nice breakfast. If you do not bring your own computer they have one in the lobby for guest use to check e-mails etc... You are close to Carabba's and Texas Roadhouse and a few other restaurants. About 8 minutes to the convention center. Negatives: Gym is tiny and has only 2 treadmills (1 was falling apart) and a weight machine that was missing parts, as well as an elliptical. I was glad I brought my kettlebells but there was barely room to swing them.

Reviews.Title: “It is what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Meecea1
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and helpful. Hotel is okay. Kind of a lingering smell to it. I needed to change rooms due to people above me being loud and was changed without a problem. Still somewhat loud, but that's due to rude people.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for. Cheap, clean, a bit run down”
Reviews.Author: KDenton
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Comfort Inn twice while visiting friends in Indy in the last two years and have been fairly happy with it both times. It's about as good a deal as you can get in the area without going down in quality. Yes, the elevator is a little jank, but the managers are friendly and the rooms are in decent shape. I have not eaten the breakfast at this hotel. On my most recent trip we checked in at 3:30 and they seemed to be having a problem with the maids getting things done and no rooms were ready. We were sent up to the one clean room only to find that there were no pillow cases, when I called down the manager apologized stating that the maid told her as soon as we'd gone upstairs. I thought they'd fix it right away, but when we left anhour later we still had no pillowcases. By the time we came back from our night out though, everything was the way it should be.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL IS A DUMP.”
Reviews.Author: propman2425
Reviews.Content: STAFF WAS VERY VERY FRIENDLY. HOWEVER, CARPET IN HALLS HAS BIG HOLES IN IT. Elevator didn't run properly. Lots of electrical tape everywhere to keep things together. BREAKFAST WAS A JOKE. Absolutely everything at this property needs to be updated. I'm not a really picky person, but this was bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place.”
Reviews.Author: joeyrk
Reviews.Content: This propert was better than what I expected. I was greeted by a wonderful lady upon check in and it was smooth and hassle free. The hotel is a bit older but it seems to have been updated somewhat recently. The room was a typical King room with no major flaws. The bathroom was a bit small but I'm traveling alone so this was not a problem. The internet service was good and I had no problems with it. The mattress has been updated recently and was very comfortable. I will stay at this property again if in the area for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: 1934ford
Reviews.Content: Just a stop over on a trip to Chicago. Check in was a snap, room was clean, bed was comfortable and check out was just as quick. Breakfast was the usual carbs and more carbs but who stays at a hotel for the breakfast?? Good area and seemed very safe.

Reviews.Title: “No Comfort in Coldness”
Reviews.Author: loves_travelling2
Reviews.Content: If you like cold showers, then this is the place for you! After a friendly check-in and comfortable sleeping, we awoke to no hot water. No explanation was offered other than everyone taking showers at the same time, around 6:30 on a Saturday morning. While it was evident that the hotel was full, it still seems mysterious they could not accomodate hot water needs.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, lousy service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: doopalas
Reviews.Content: Moving from Florida to Wisconsin, we had about 14 hours in on the road when we choose a hotel for the night. We used a coupon from those green travel magazines that you find in gas stations and restaurants. At first the large, young clerk seemed friendly, but as soon as I showed her the coupon, her demeanor and room "availability" changed. Generally she was rude, with short answers to our questions, including why we were forced to stay in a smoking room when both me and my fiance overheard her talking to her co-worker about all these non-smoking rooms that were available, but "not to us." Road weary, we decided to just accept the smoky stinky room and called it a night. I tried to complain the next morning, but since a manager wasn't on duty (big surprise), we got nowhere. In addition, my credit card wasn't charged for the room until December, even though we stayed in June. I tried to protest it on my credit card, but got nowhere since there's proof that I actually signed for it. I wanted so bad to have the charged taken off given the way we were treated and 2nd-class citizens because of a coupon!

Reviews.Title: “Not fun.”
Reviews.Author: DjaksMom
Reviews.Content: Live close and needed a room for a night while getting work done to our house. Booked this one due to proximity and pool for kids. Outside pool was the smallest I've ever seen in my life. Not much bigger than a hot tub! Had toilet problems immediately and throughout the stay. Had to use the public restroom as the desk clerk couldn't find a plunger for HOURS! Breakfast is basically yogurt and oj that's undrinkable. They say this generic "everything is prepackaged" breakfast is due to new Marion County Health Dept. laws. Desk clerk on check in was awful, desk clerk at check out was great. Please find something else in area....there's plenty better around.

Reviews.Title: “Under the Circumstances...”
Reviews.Author: umslgrad
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and quiet, but we ran out of hot water in the morning. The most notable thing was that our daughter left behind a treasured stuffed animal. We didn't realize it until we got home. After a late night call to the front desk, the attendant found it and mailed it to us.

Reviews.Title: “Close to what I want.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is 12 minutes from IMS. That makes it easy to drive to without the full Indy hassle. Grocery stores are just down the street and more importantly there is a good Chinese restraunt sharing the parking lot for lazy eating. When you're in the mood for something nice to eat then its also 12 mins away from St. Elmo's, best steak in town(bring a thick wallet). Let's see....racing, food and convenience at a fair price. Satisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel with my parents. We were all in town for the 2006 Indy 500. My parents have stayed at this hotel in the past, because of the convenience and low rates. We all made our reservations for this year's Memorial Day weekend a YEAR in advance. But when we arrived at the hotel, the front desk staff tried to charge us all a higher rate. Also, my husband and I had to check in a day late, so we called the hotel weeks in advance & told them this -- we were told it would be no problem. However, when we checked in, we were told that if my parents had not checked in for us the day before (when they checked in), the hotel would have completely cancelled our reservation!! When we made our reservations a year ago, we had requested 2 rooms near each other on the third floor. They did not honor our request. Our room on the third floor was adequate, and it had good air conditioning. My parents' room on the second floor was noisy. Most unbelievable of all, the "lobby" (basically a check in desk), guest room hallways, and breakfast room had NO air conditioning. I asked the front desk staff if the AC was broken, but she said it's never air conditioned in those areas. This is unbelievable (and unacceptable, especially in the breakfast area) because the temps outside were 95+ degrees! There is also an outdoor pool -- that we thought should have been cleaned and ready for guest use given the extremely hot temps and the fact that it was Memorial Day weekend! However, it was full of disgusting, thick green water(?), with bottles & a chair in it. We could see the pool from our window, and it was disgusting! We are definitely NOT staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: IrishFrau
Reviews.Content: We have relatives in Indy, stay in the area several times a year and have tried many hotels. The rooms could use updating (there was evidence of water problems on the bathroom ceiling), but they are clean, the staff is friendly and the breakfast room is nice. All in all, a good value. This is likely to become our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: HappierTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is an acceptable place to stay if your visiting University of Indianapolis or passing through on I65. While not a luxury motel it is fairly clean and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I have stayed here at least 5 times in the last year and will probably make this "home" for the next 4 years as my son attends U of I.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn South
HotelInfo.Address: 5040 S. East St., Indianapolis, IN 46227
